TopicTitle: Project Odyssey: adventures getting home from an alternate dimension

Articles.Content: Maybe because I am almost at Duna and have said that I'm wrapping things up as soon as I finish the base and excavation?

So, is it really going to be THE LAST episode of Odyssey? As I see now, it tooks a lot of time to finish projects like this. I know I've already told you about this iin Youtube coments, but have you considered recording KSP with mods, that add another planets and distant star systems? Because no one ever made a full-scale series about it, and we know you can. We want YOU to go there!

It's not even close to the last, in the way you're thinking.

I don't have any plans for adding planets in the near future.
When do you think Episode 46 will be released? Like an approximation?

Is Episode 46 going to be the last one of the series ?

Edited June 23, 2015 by LividPumpkin
Wow this is getting long... 38:10 and climbing. I totally underestimated the duration. I'm not going to even guess anymore.

Wow this is getting long... 38:10 and climbing. I totally underestimated the duration. I'm not going to even guess anymore.

It will be epic:)
So it is going to be a double-length episode? Just another "All good things...". But definitely going to be good! Hope next monday is time!

I'm getting 2-3 minutes done per day on average. If I had to guess at duration, let's say 60 minutes. I'm at 38, making 22 to go. That's 10-15 days before I'll be done. There is a chance it'll be July 12, I guess, but who really knows. Not me. The episode might get longer than 60. Might be less. I might get delayed. I might get inspired. I make no true predictions about this.
Teaser photo!

Hi,

I've been following your series for a while now.

Can you recommend a fairly easy way to record an entire mission? I have a fairly beefy system, so was wondering if OBS was best or if I should try something else.

Thanks
I have only ever used Fraps.

Teaser photo!

http://i.imgur.com/kt4mDIl.png

Holy moly that looks like a ton of work and filming.

The amount of work and love to detail is by all means impressive. I really like all series created by you, Fellbourn. So far only Vaos' Duna One videos can compete with the quality - also a wide variety of nice scenery and craft.

Thank you for all those entertaining hours!

I have only ever used Fraps.

OK, thanks.

Can FRAPS record a window and not the entire screen?

I play in windowed mode, so yes.

Edited June 27, 2015 by Felbourn

42:00 minutes

But no great answers have been revealed yet.

Well, great answers is the thing you don't get too much while playing KSP. You know, back here in Russia, I have a friend, who is a serious LetsPlay guy (always thinks about quality of his content), and he is interested in making KSP videos. He never played it before, but he is quickly learning. (GregTech mod for minecraft, which he plays and records, is not a thing for noobs). His idea was to make the "videos about history of spaceflight". I've told him that there's a guy, his name is Bob and he makes Project Alexandria. Now he is watching your videos and really inspired by them. So, you may not get The Great Answer, but you get subscribers AND followers who want to make interesting KSP stuff. Btw, waiting for Alexandria together.
If Episode 46 is not finished when Operation Gold Strike is finished airing, what should we expect?

If Episode 46 is not finished when Operation Gold Strike is finished airing, what should we expect?

Probably something about Juno in RSS, or more likely the beginning of an MKS from USI playthrough.

Odyssey #46 duration update... 45:33.

I think 15-25 more minutes might be enough.

Wow it takes you a really long time. I REALLY HOPE we'll see it next week.

- - - Updated - - -

Btw, have you finished all the recording? Is it editing that you do now?
No, for this episode I am making the video and laying out the tracks all at the same time, going back and forth between the tasks. Most episodes are not done this way, and most don't take this long.

OK, thanks.

Can FRAPS record a window and not the entire screen?

Fraps will record a window OR the full screen depending on how you set it up.
Can we see something like Juno in RSS? You said that you would do it.
